passages.text: August 29, 2025 07:32 AM GMT
Kureha (4023) | Japan
WHAT'S CHANGEDKureha (4023.T)FromPrice Target¥2,800
We expect agrochemical shipments to have troughed in 1Q and OP to keep pace with the company plan as PGA impairment losses also drop out from 2Q.

We forecast 2Q OP of \(\yen 4.0bn\) \((+6\%\text{YoY})\) vs. the 1Q result of \(\yen 2.3bn\) \((- 27\%\text{YoY})\) Dividends are to be guided by DOE of \(5.0\%\) up until F3/27 but the firm has not clarified its approach from F3/28.

Raise PT to \(\yen 3,300\) , stay EW: Our post- 1Q review of forecasts lifts our PT from \(\yen 2,800\) to \(\yen 3,300\) (target F3/27 P/E 12.2x \(\rightarrow\) 12.5x, past- 10yr avg. + 1 standard deviation). PT implies roughly \(15\%\) downside, but we expect the relatively high dividend yield within the industry to support near- term share prices and keep our rating at EW. We also see risk of future dividend cuts.

Key points on 1Q results: \(\yen 2.3bn\) OP \((- 27\%\text{YoY})\) missed our \(\yen 3.4bn\) forecast. We had not factored for an estimated \(\yen 400\) mn in PGA inventory writedowns (polyglycolic acid; advanced materials segment), and agrochem shipments (specialty chemicals) were also pushed back to 2Q/later. Specialty plastics also seem to have met with purchasing restraint ahead of the July 1 launch of NEW Krewrap in packages with Pokemon designs.

Earnings forecasts: We forecast 2Q OP of \(\yen 4.0bn\) \((+6\%\text{YoY})\) , expecting agrochem sales to rise to \(\yen 2.2bn\) \((+22\%\text{YoY})\) from \(\yen 700\) mn in 1Q \((- 73\%)\) , and the absence of PGA inventory writedowns to boost the advanced materials OPM from just under \(1\%\) in 1Q to just shy \(6\%\) in 2Q. Our F3/26 full- year OP forecast of \(\yen 14.0bn\) \((+49\%)\) assumes a weaker yen than previously from 2Q and is in line with guidance/unchanged from our previous forecast. Our \(\yen 15.0bn\) forecast for F3/27 \((+7\%)\) is higher than \(\yen 13.5bn\) previously after adjusting our FX assumption \((\yen 140\rightarrow \yen 145/\$ )\) and considering emerging signs of PGA recovery.

Thoughts on the share price: Our F3/26 real OP excl. inventory appraisals in core advanced materials is \(\yen 1bn\) , incl. black ink of \(\sim \yen 500\) mn for PVDF (Lib cathode binder). There could be risk of writedowns (risk of F3/27 dividend cut) if below this. The stock is being supported by annual DPS of \(\yen 219\) based on \(5.0\%\) DOE, but this guide is only in place until F3/27, and we also think it possible that reduced balance sheet leeway due to heavy PVDF spending ( \(\yen 70bn\) ) and shareholder rewards could trim DOE to \(3 - 4\%\) from F3/28. Despite near- term dividend yield appeal we stay EW.
MORGAN STANLEY MUFG SECURITIES CO., LTD.
Ryoichi Watanabe Equity Analyst
Kureha (4023.T, 4023 JP)
Fine Chemicals | Japan

Morgan Stanley does and seeks to do business with companies covered in Morgan Stanley Research. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of Morgan Stanley Research. Investors should consider Morgan Stanley Research as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

High dividend appealing, but many issues for both PVDF and PGA
Key: - Historical Stock Performance Current Stock Price Price Target
Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research
Supply/demand is easing for PVDF used as LiB cathode binder, given entry of Chinese makers.
Volume growth has been limited for PGA- derived frac plugs used in shale oil
excavation, leading to ongoing losses with
the exception of one- time valuation gains.
The lack of, and slow developments
around, new businesses/products is an issue. We foresee contribution from new agrochemical products in 2030 or so.
Consensus Rating Distribution
Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research
Electric Vehicles: Positive View descriptions of Risk Rewards Themes here

With rising demand for xEVs with extended driving range, demand for PVDF materials that are well- suited for use in NCM cathodes also expands, resulting in potential upside of \(\sim 30\%\) in Kureha's advanced plastics sales (Advanced Materials segment). Also \(\sim 30\%\) upside for Krewarp sales. Bull- case fair value applies a P/E of 12.5x (10yr historical avg + one standard deviation) to a F3/27 EPS estimate of ¥403.0.
Base case fair value multiple is P/E of 12.5x (10yr historical avg + one standard deviation), applied to our F3/27 EPS forecast of ¥264.3.

Shale oil exploration demand recedes as oil prices fall in a deteriorating economic setting, and with xEV penetration also stalling, sales in the Advanced Materials segment undershoot by 20%. Krewrap also undershoots by 20% amid purchasing restraint. Bear case fair value applies P/E of 10.3x (10yr historical avg) to a F3/27 EPS estimate of ¥172.7.

Announcement of share buybacks/dividend increase. Recovery in PVDF used in Lib cathode binder. Expansion of plugs for use in shale oil exploration.
Source: Morgan Stanley Research Estimate View explanation of regional hierarchies here
5/5 3 Month MOST Horizon
Source: Refinitiv, FactSet, Morgan Stanley Research; 1 is the highest favored Quintile and 5 is the least favored Quintile
Expansion in the lithium- ion battery market driven by xEVs. Potential for rapid increase in suspension polymerized PVDF copolymer demand, a company strength, if NMC cathodes notably gain favor.
Fewer new shale oil projects due to lower crude oil prices. Risk of major impact from lower demand for Krewrap food packaging as more people eat out.
Source: Refinitiv, Morgan Stanley Research

Within the last 12 months, Morgan Stanley managed or co- managed a public offering (or 144A offering) of securities of Mitsubishi Gas Chemical, Nippon Sanso Holdings, UBE.
Within the last 12 months, Morgan Stanley has received compensation for investment banking services from Mitsubishi Gas Chemical, Nippon Sanso Holdings, UBE.

In the next 3 months, Morgan Stanley expects to receive or intends to seek compensation for investment banking services from Air Water, Daicel, Denka, DIC, Kaneka, Kureha, Mitsubishi Gas Chemical, Nippon Sanso Holdings, Seksiu Chemical, Teijin, Tokuyama, Toray Industries, UBE.

Within the last 12 months, Morgan Stanley has provided or is providing investment banking services to, or has an investment banking client relationship with, the following company: Air Water, Daicel, DIC, Mitsubishi Gas Chemical, Nippon Sanso Holdings, Seksiu Chemical, Teijin, Tokuyama, Toray Industries, UBE.

Within the last 12 months, Morgan Stanley has either provided or is providing non- investment banking, securities- related services to and/or in the past has entered into an agreement to provide services or has a client relationship with the following company: Seksiu Chemical, Teijin, UBE.

The equity research analysts or strategists principally responsible for the preparation of Morgan Stanley Research have received compensation based upon various factors, including quality of research, investor client feedback, stock picking, competitive factors, firm revenues and overall investment banking revenues. Equity Research analysts' or strategists' compensation is not linked to investment banking or capital markets transactions performed by Morgan Stanley or the profitability or revenues of particular trading desks.

Morgan Stanley and its affiliates do business that relates to companies/instruments covered in Morgan Stanley Research, including market making, providing liquidity, fund management, commercial banking, extension of credit, investment services and investment banking. Morgan Stanley sells to and buys from customers the securities/instruments of companies covered in Morgan Stanley Research on a principal basis. Morgan Stanley may have a position in the debt of the Company or instruments discussed in this report. Morgan Stanley trades or may trade as principal in the debt securities (or in related derivatives) that are the subject of the debt research report.
Certain disclosures listed above are also for compliance with applicable regulations in non- US jurisdictions.

Morgan Stanley uses a relative rating system using terms such as Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated or Underweight (see definitions below). Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold and sell. Investors should carefully read the definitions of all ratings used in Morgan Stanley Research. In addition, since Morgan Stanley Research contains more complete information concerning the analyst's views, investors should carefully read Morgan Stanley Research, in its entirety, and not infer the contents from the rating alone. In any case, ratings (or research) should not be used or relied upon as investment advice. An investor's decision to buy or sell a stock should depend on individual circumstances (such as the investor's existing holdings) and other considerations.
(as of July 31, 2025)

The Stock Ratings described below apply to Morgan Stanley's Fundamental Equity Research and do not apply to Debt Research produced by the Firm. For disclosure purposes only (in accordance with FINRA requirements), we include the category headings of Buy, Hold, and Sell alongside our ratings of Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight. Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal- weight and Not- Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Data include common stock and ADRs currently assigned ratings. Investment Banking Clients are companies from whom Morgan Stanley received investment banking compensation in the last 12 months. Due to rounding off of decimals, the percentages provided in the % of total' column may not add up to exactly 100 percent.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.
In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.
Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia -relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub-regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.

Morgan Stanley Research policy is to update research reports as and when the Research Analyst and Research Management deem appropriate, based on developments with the issuer, the sector, or the market that may have a material impact on the research views or opinions stated therein. In addition, certain Research publications are intended to be updated on a regular periodic basis (weekly/monthly/quarterly/annual) and will ordinarily be updated with that frequency, unless the Research Analyst and Research Management determine that a different publication schedule is appropriate based on current conditions.
